snippet: As word of the accord spread, relieved New Yorkers rekindled arrangements for weekend getaways and Long Islanders shelved contingency plans for commuting the hard way.
abstract: New Yorkers relieved by end of standoff between Long Island Rail Road and its unions rekindle arrangements for weekend getaways, and Long Islanders shelve contingency plans for commuting during anticipated strike.

byline.contributor: Ruth Bashinsky and Joseph Berger contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: As word of the accord spread, relieved New Yorkers rekindled arrangements for weekend getaways and Long Islanders shelved contingency plans for commuting the hard way.

headline.main: On Long Island, a Collective Sigh of Relief
headline.print_headline: On Long Island, a Collective Sigh of Relief From Those Making Contingency Plans
